text: Jagjivan Ram (5 April 1908 â€“ 6 July 1986), mostly known as Babuji, was an Indian independence activist and politician from Bihar. He was instrumental in starting the All-India Depressed Classes League, an organisation dedicated to attaining equality for untouchables in 1935. He was elected to Bihar Legislative Assembly in 1937 after which he organised the rural labour movement. ==References== Category:1908 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Indian activists Category:Bihari politicians Category:Indian Deputy Prime Ministers Category:Presidents of the Indian National Congress Category:Indian National Congress politicians
title: Jagjivan Ram
